results.title: Between Utopia and crisis
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 16 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The march of Modernism which had begun in the decade before the First World War, continued in the period that followed. The alienation from the centuries-old traditions of Western art became even stronger; the revolutionary attack on bourgeois society and its values broadened from an artisitc minority to political mass movements. The program looks at the challenges of Dadaism and Surrealism, and the architecture of this period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

results.title: The Passionate eye
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The influence of Napoleon on French art and architecture is examined. The Emperor encouraged the classical Roman style. The age of Romanticism is studied in which the direct expression of natural feeling is extolled above the control of intellect.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

results.title: The Northern Renaissance
results.creator_credit: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Art of the western world”.
The love of minutely observed detail is one of the characteristics that distinguishes the art of the Northern Renaissance from that of Italy. Although the Italians too, studied the surfaces of things, their intent was to work from the inner form outwards, seeking an organising principle or harmony outlying outward appearances. It is in the work of Jan van Eyck and the master Albrecht Durer, that the style of the Northern Renaissance is best showcased.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

Although the Italians too, studied the surfaces of things, their intent was to work from the inner form outwards, seeking an organising principle or harmony outlying outward appearances. results.title: Art of the western world
results.creator_credit: Tony Cash, Andrew Snell, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description: Traces the history of art from the ancient Greek classical style, to the modern era. Focuses on painting, sculpture and architecture, highlighting the critical works and achievements of the artists of each period. Michael Wood narrates, and renowned art historians give their insight into the history of art.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Cash, Andrew Snell, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

Michael Wood narrates, and renowned art historians give their insight into the history of art.

Focuses on painting, sculpture and architecture, highlighting the critical works and achievements of the artists of each period. Michael Wood narrates, and renowned art historians give their insight into the history of art.

results.title: Distanced creations
results.creator_credit: Melissa Llewelyn-Davies, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 14 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Neo-Impressionists and Post-Impressionists abandoned the techniques of the Impressionists, however the diversity of styles and techniques greatly varied among the celebrated artists of the time. Colour, form and content was influenced by an awareness of non-European art such as Japanese woodcuts, and scientific theories of colour which artists Seurat and Cezanne practised with almost mathematical precision. Gaugin’s lifelong passion for the exotique, Van Gogh’s highly emotive style or Lautrec’s interest in the bohemian side of Paris represent the creative energies of the period.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Melissa Llewelyn-Davies, Channel Four and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)

Gaugin’s lifelong passion for the exotique, Van Gogh’s highly emotive style or Lautrec’s interest in the bohemian side of Paris represent the creative energies of the period.

results.title: Dogfood
results.brief_description: Watching TV, driving around, eating peanut butter, trying to get a job. A film about the sort of people who live in the suburbs.

results.title: The Colonel
results.creator_credit: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An army colonel, having outlived his usefulness to the revolution, is imprisoned. Refusing to sign a false confession, he is eventually forced into a position of choice - his principles or his life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jenifer Hooks, Rolf De Heer and AFTRS

results.title: Switch on the night
results.creator_credit: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sarah Royds, Susan Cornish, Alejandra Canales and AFTRS
results.description: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
description_for_label: A poetic documentary exploring stories of seven refugee children in Australia – their experiences of immigration, their memories, dreams and fears. All of them have experienced life in Australian immigration detention centres in Villawood, Baxter and Port Hedland but a large part of this reality remains unseen.
